title: runner.pm: 'use of uninitialized value'
body:
### I did this

While running torture tests in GHA/linux 'CM openssl torture FTP', this error happened:
```
Wed, 09 Jul 2025 00:35:44 GMT
test 1348...[FTP download, file without Content-Disposition inside, using -O]
Wed, 09 Jul 2025 00:35:53 GMT
Use of uninitialized value in join or string at /home/runner/work/curl/curl/tests/runner.pm line 774.
Wed, 09 Jul 2025 00:49:57 GMT
Error: The action 'run tests' has timed out after 15 minutes.
```
https://github.com/curl/curl/actions/runs/16157402085/job/45602590085?pr=17768#step:39:743

One possible issue is the error reported by Perl,
the other is that the process hangs after that point till the step timeout kicks in.

I remember seeing this before, but it's rare.

`runner.pm` code around the failing line:
https://github.com/curl/curl/blob/784c17b7d98caa9b500a56e345c1aadca9d009ed/tests/runner.pm#L770-L781

The issue did not repeat when re-running the failed job:
https://github.com/curl/curl/actions/runs/16157402085/job/45620561841?pr=17768
(the repeat run executed on a newer image: ubuntu-24.04 20250629.1.0, but
it seems unlikely to be related, because the job run fine on 20250622.1.0 many times.)

### I expected the following

To not be flaky.


### curl/libcurl version

master 784c17b7d98caa9b500a56e345c1aadca9d009ed (with an unrelated patch on top: 5c23c23a6020293c026814f62b5f7d5c774421bb via #17768)


### operating system

seen on Ubuntu Linux (GHA ubuntu-24.04 Version: 20250622.1.0)
